qas.question: Who offered Queen a management deal in 1972?
Which singer used Trident studios in addition to Queen and the Beatles?
What was the name of Trident's subsidiary?
Where was Queen spotted before entering discussions with Trident?
In what year did Queen enter discussions with Trident studios?

context: In <a4_0>1972<a4_0/>, Queen entered discussions with Trident Studios after being spotted at <a3_0>De La Lane Studios<a3_0/> by John Anthony and after discussions were offered a management deal by <a0_0>Norman Sheffield<a0_0/> under <a2_0>Neptune Productions<a2_0/>, a subsidiary of Trident to manage the band and enable them to use the facilities at Trident to record new material whilst the management search for a record label to sign Queen. This suited both parties at the time as Trident were expanding into management and Queen under the deal were able to make use of the hi-tech recording facilities shared by bands at the time such as the Beatles and <a1_0>Elton John<a1_0/> to produce new material. However, Trident found it difficult to find a label for a band bearing a name with such connotation during the early 1970s.
